content.text:
## Community Discussions

The ElizaOS Discord was active with discussions across several channels. In the main discussion channel, users debated the potential migration from 'ai16z' token to 'ElizaOS', with some advocating for immediate action while others cautioned about potential negative price impacts. There was frustration expressed about the current platform developer (Bao/baoskee) not delivering promised features like voting functionality.

A moderation incident occurred where a community member (DorianD) was temporarily kicked from the server but was later reinstated after review. The community manager clarified that this was done by a moderator who had been inactive for 9 days and that they would review who has access to kick privileges.

## Auto.fun Platform Issues

Several users reported problems with the Auto.fun platform, including:

1. Tokens stuck in migration for extended periods (12-20 hours)
2. A critical bug with the Quill token that incorrectly represented the token-to-SOL ratio, allowing someone to drain the liquidity pool
3. Black screens during token creation attempts
4. Tokens not appearing after creation

The team acknowledged these issues and provided updates. For the Quill incident, they clarified it wasn't an exploit but a bug, deployed a fix, and promised refunds to affected users. Users were directed to fill out a Tally form to document their issues for potential refunds.

## Development Updates

There was minimal technical discussion in the coders channel. A user named 'notorious_d_e_v' shared a live stream of Auto.fun development. Another user submitted a PR (#48) for a Livepeer plugin that offers "free incentivized inference" and was seeking review. Some users experienced crashes when running applications despite having good hardware, suggesting potential code issues.

A request was made to add ai16z and DegenAI to the Featured and Marketcap tabs on Auto.fun. There was also discussion about implementing proper DAO governance tools and creating an "eli5" bot with specific personality traits.

## Community Suggestions

Several suggestions were made to improve the platform and community:

1. Implement bug bounty and auditing services to prevent LP bugs
2. Create separate partner channels for serious and non-serious discussions
3. Highlight Clank Tank winners on Auto.fun with voting for weekly winners
4. Implement proper Discord moderation structure with bot integration
5. Design token migration mechanism if proceeding with rebrand
6. Add Ledger support for the platform
7. Implement better communication channels for critical issues

The community also discussed the potential for NSFW AI applications, with one user offering technical guidance on implementing uncensored AI models using ComfyUI with Civitai Loras.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository recently:

1. Documentation improvements: PR #4366 by samihao11 clarifies the paths for framework users versus core contributors.

2. New functionality: PR #3894 by mindxploit adds permanent knowledge capability to the system.

3. Bug fixes: 
   - PR #3890 by daniel-trevino fixes loading character plugins from remote URLs
   - PR #4367 by PixelPil0t1 corrects a broken Pump.fun link
   - PR #4369 by Vid201 adds default project text to the create CLI

4. Development improvements: PR #4370 by ai16z-demirix adds test coverage and setup for the Anthropic plugin.

The crypto market shows price fluctuations for major cryptocurrencies. WETH (Wrapped Ethereum) has increased from $1,786.73 to $1,821.64, representing a gain of approximately 1.95%. Meanwhile, SOL (Solana) has decreased from $150.94 to $149.24, showing a slight decline of about 1.13%.

categories.title: Auto.fun and its Relationship with ai16z and degenAI

content.text: According to a Discord conversation in the spartan_holders channel, Auto.fun was well planned and executed, creating an ai16z liquidity pool through buy fees for tokens launched on the platform. This arrangement is expected to benefit degenAI in the long term, as ai16z will drive buybacks for degenAI. The user Phenowin expressed excitement about future developments from the elizaos team, specifically mentioning v2 of degenAI and Eliza OS. Another user, Odilitime, simply agreed with this assessment.

The Discord conversation discusses the implementation of visemes (mouth shapes for speech) in a character animation system. Godfreyart reported successfully getting a show to step through JSON data and load audio with visemes, but noted that artists need to fix the viseme order and schema for each character for proper implementation. Godfreyart shared specific requirements for morphtargets/blendkeys, indicating that the first 15 should follow a default pattern for speech animation.

There was also discussion about whether to keep or remove the Unity version of 'Clanktank' since the project appears to be moving to PlayCanvas. Smsithlord suggested keeping a backup of the Unity version as a precaution, noting uncertainty about plans for maintaining the same shows across multiple platforms.

The key technical tasks identified include fixing the visemes order and schema for each character, ensuring morphtargets/blendkeys follow the specified pattern for the first 15 positions, and deciding on whether to keep or remove the Unity Clanktank version.

Over the past two days (April 26-28, 2025), the elizaos/eliza repository has shown consistent activity with 4 new pull requests submitted, though none have been merged yet. There was 1 new issue opened on April 26-27, with no new issues the following day. The project had 6 active contributors on April 26-27, which decreased to 3 active contributors on April 27-28.
sources: From 2025-04-26 to 2025-04-27, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 1 new issues, and 6 active contributors.
From 2025-04-27 to 2025-04-28, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.

categories.title: Issue #4368: What is required in token swap using evm plugin?

content.text: GitHub issue #4368 was opened by user 0xopsdev regarding requirements for token swaps using the EVM plugin in the elizaOS/eliza repository. The specific details of the issue would require accessing the GitHub issue directly.

## Auto.fun Platform

Auto.fun is a recently launched token launchpad (less than a week old) that has been open-sourced by the ElizaOS team. The platform has generated mixed reactions from community members, with some expressing concerns about its similarity to pump.fun and questioning its long-term utility. The platform reportedly generated around $2k in fees during a single day.

A significant issue occurred with a token called Quill during migration, where a bug incorrectly represented the token-to-SOL ratio, allowing someone to drain the liquidity pool by selling at a premium. The team clarified it wasn't an exploit but a bug, deployed a fix, and promised refunds to affected users in SOL.

Other reported issues included tokens not showing up after creation, black screens during token launch attempts, and tokens being stuck in migration for extended periods (12-20 hours).

## ElizaOS Development

The team is working on Eliza v2 alongside auto.fun development. The project follows an open-source approach, inviting developer contributions rather than adhering to strict roadmaps. As osintmao9 mentioned, "They don't really operate on roadmaps or deadlines. They just code. A lot."

There are ongoing discussions about a potential token migration from "ai16z" to "ElizaOS" due to frustrations with a platform developer named Bao/baoskee. Community members debate the mechanics and implications of a token swap, with concerns about liquidity, exchange coordination, and potential market impact.

The official contract addresses were shared:
- ai16z: HeLp6NuQkmYB4pYWo2zYs22mESHXPQYzXbB8n4V98jwC
- degenai: Gu3LDkn7Vx3bmCzLafYNKcDxv2mH7YN44NJZFXnypump

## AI Agent Development

Several discussions centered on the current lack of revenue-generating AI agents in the ecosystem, with most existing agents focused on entertainment or alpha rather than practical utility. As one user noted, "revenue generating agents are not there" and "alpha agents like aixbt etc are only there."

There's interest in developing an "eli5" bot with specific personality traits, described as a "terminally online tiktok rich 14 year old that keeps skipping grades and thinks hes hot shit."

In the technical realm, one developer reported successfully implementing a character animation system using JSON and visemes (mouth shapes for speech) but noted that artists need to fix the viseme order and schema for each character.

## Community Management

A moderation incident occurred where a community member (DorianD) was temporarily kicked from the server by a moderator who had been inactive for 9 days. This was later reversed after review. The incident prompted discussions about proper Discord moderation structure, with suggestions to implement a bot-based moderation system with clear role hierarchies.

There were also requests for separate partner channels for serious and non-serious discussions, and better communication channels for critical issues.
